text.0: ye twain who rule in heaven and earth the region clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness.
text.1: may the imperial varuṇa and mitra and highborn aryaman accept our presents.
text.2: kings guards of rrtighty everlasting order come hitherward ye princes lords of rivers.
text.3: send us from heaven o varuṇa and mitra rain and sweet food ye who pour down your bounties.
text.4: may the dear god and varuṇa and mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways.
text.5: that foes may say unto sudās our chieftain may we too joy in food with gods to guard us.
text.6: him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit who makes the song rise upward and sustains it.
text.7: bedew with fatness varuṇa nd mitra ye kings make glad the pleasant dwellingplaces.
text.8: to you this laud o varuṇa and mitra is offered like bright soma juice to vāyu.
text.9: favour our songs of praise wake thought and spirit preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
